intro: Coutarea alba, commonly known as white couture, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its showy white flowers. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its elegant appearance.
